title.native: 狼と香辛料 MERCHANT MEETS THE WISE WOLF
title.romaji: Ookami to Koushinryou: MERCHANT MEETS THE WISE WOLF
title.english: Spice and Wolf: MERCHANT MEETS THE WISE WOLF

description:
Lawrence is a traveling merchant selling various goods from a horse-drawn cart. One day, he arrives at a village and meets a beautiful girl with the ears and tail of an animal! Her name is Holo the Wisewolf and she brings bountiful harvests. She wishes to return to her homeland, and Lawrence offers to take her. Now, the once-lonely merchant and the once-lonely wisewolf begin their journey north.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: สาวหมาป่ากับนายเครื่องเทศ

node.description: [Website](http://hasekuraisuna.jp) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hasekura2/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/i_hasekura) Isuna Hasekura is a Japanese author. In 2005, Hasekura won the Silver Prize in the twelfth Dengeki Novel Prize with his debut novel [Spice and Wolf](https://anilist.co/manga/39115/Ookami-to-Koushinryou). The first volume was published the following year.
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).

__Origin:__ Perth, Australia
__Alma Mater:__ Royal College of Music (2015)

[Website](https://www.kpenkmusic.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kevinpenkin) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kevinpenkincomposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kpenkin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD05wgzXUYvA7rIE3XGfFFg) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kevinpenkin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Penkin)

An Australian anime composer and video game composer. He is best known for composing the award-winning score to the anime [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/).

Penkin grew up in Perth, Australia. His interest in game music came from listening to the "Phendrana Drifts" theme from Metroid Prime; in a 2012 interview, he referred to the theme's electronic synths and acoustic instruments as "absolute bliss." Penkin began his career with composition credits in the 2011 short films Play Lunch and The Adventures of Chipman and Biscuit Boy. In the same year, Penkin composed the soundtrack of the video game Jūzaengi: Engetsu Sangokuden; this soundtrack represented Penkin's first collaboration with [Nobuo Uematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100150). Penkin has continued to collaborate with Uematsu in titles such as Norn9 and Defender’s Quest II: Mists of Ruin.

In 2015, Penkin graduated from the Royal College of Music with a Master's degree in Composition for Screen. In 2016, Penkin collaborated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/) on the [Norn9](https://anilist.co/anime/20643/) anime and the [Under the Dog](https://anilist.co/anime/21002/) original video animation soundtracks. Penkin's relationship with Kinema Citrus continued through to 2017 for the soundtrack of [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/), winning the 2017 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it. In 2018, Penkin composed the score for the video game Florence. Penkin composed the music for Kinema Citrus' adaptation of [The Rising of the Shield Hero](https://anilist.co/anime/99263/) and NetEase's VR game Nostos in 2019. Penkin most recently composed the music for the 2020 anime adaptation of the South Korean webtoon [Tower of God](https://anilist.co/anime/115230/), winning the 2021 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it.

He used to live in the United Kingdom, but currently resides in Melbourne, Australia.

__[Website](http://www.clarismusic.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ClariS_Staff)__ | __[Artist Page (Sacra Music)](https://sacramusic.jp/artist/#claris)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ClariSofficial)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-zeaPnxZHE3EcTyVl1fTdw)__

__Formed:__ 2009
__Genres:__ J-POP, Synthpop, Pop rock, Anison

__Biography:__
ClariS is a Japanese singing group under record label [Sacra Music](https://sacramusic.jp/) (2017-), having previously been under [SME Records](https://www.sme.co.jp/s/SME/company/SML?ima=3832) (2010-2017) the group consisted of two high school girls who gained popularity through the video sharing site Nico Nico Douga as “アリス☆クララ" ("Alice☆Clara") in 2009 and 2010. They have since changed their name to “ClariS” for their major debut in 2010, which means “sunny, clean and bright” in Latin. Since they were still high school students and wanted to focus on their school studies, they would not reveal their identities. Therefore, they would only be shown as illustrations. They both started their high school education in April 2012, according to their official Twitter.  When drawn, Clara is depicted wearing pink items, and Alice is shown wearing blue items. Images of the crescent moon are used as a motif to represent Clara, and the sun is used to represent Alice, which comes from their personal preferences. Clara is shown with slightly wavy hair and no bangs, while Alice is drawn with straight hair with bangs.

In 2014, Alice left ClariS to focus on her studies. Clara was then joined by her friend Karen whom she met when they were classmates at the same music school. When drawn, Karen is depicted wearing pastel green items, and images of stars are used to represent her.

On the 1st September 2024, ClariS Karen announced her graduation after ClariS AUTUMN TOUR 2024.

__Members:__
- Clara (クララ) (2009-)
- Ellie (エリー) (2025-)
- Anna (アンナ) (2025-)

__Former Members:__
- Alice (アリス) (2009-2014)
- Karen (カレン) (2014-2024)
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/118512/) or [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/218342/) by the same name._
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).
